options.content:
# Amazon Redshift Privileges

This dashboard shows privileges defined in Amazon Redshift.

Access control to database objects are defined by combination of identity, object and privilege. 

- Identity: User, Role, Group
- Object: Database, Schema, Table/View, Column, Function, Procedure, Language, Datashare, ML Model
- Privilege: CREATE, SELECT, ALTER, DROP, DELETE, INSERT, ... (depends on the object)

Visit **Amazon Redshift Identities and Objects** dashboard to show identities and database objects in Amazon Redshift.

## Roles assigned to User

This panel shows roles assigned to a user, including roles inherited from other roles. 

- To administrate roles, use [GRANT ROLE](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/r_GRANT.html), [REVOKE ROLE](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/r_REVOKE.html).
- `level` is a number of layers for ancestor roles counted from a user. `level` 0 is for the user itself. `level` 1 is a parent role assigned to the user directly and level 2 is a grandparent role attached to the parent role.

targets.rawSQL:
-- This queries 5 layers of Role for given user. 
-- Searching parent roles for more than 6 layer is disabled for performance reason. You can add more levels if you need to retrive parents over level 6 but keep in mind that this may impact query performance. 
-- Note: The query can be rewritten by recursive CTE but recursive CTE does not work with system table due to restriction of leader node function. 
select 
case when level=0 then role_name else repeat(chr(160), level*4) ||  role_name end as role, 
level
from (

WITH
target_roles (role_id, role_name) as (
select role_id, role_name
from svv_user_grants 
where user_name in (${users:singlequote})
),

ancestors1 (role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, level, levelpath) as (
-- get records with parents
select role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, 1 as level, role_id::varchar as levelpath
from svv_role_grants
where role_id in (select role_id from target_roles)

union all

-- get records without parents (top node)
select role_id as role_id, role_name as role_name, null as granted_role_id, null as granted_role_name, 1 as level, role_id::varchar as levelpath
from target_roles
where role_id not in (select role_id from svv_role_grants)
),

ancestors2 (role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, level, levelpath) as (
-- get records matches with parents
select t1.role_id, t1.role_name, t1.granted_role_id, t1.granted_role_name, 2 as level, t2.levelpath || '@' || t1.role_id as levelpath
from svv_role_grants t1
left join ancestors1 t2
on t1.role_id = t2.granted_role_id
where t1.role_id in (select granted_role_id from ancestors1)

union all

-- get records without parents (top node)
select granted_role_id as role_id, granted_role_name as role_name, null as granted_role_id, null granted_role_name, 2 as level, levelpath || '@' || granted_role_id
from ancestors1
where granted_role_id is not null
and granted_role_id not in (select role_id from svv_role_grants)
),

ancestors3 (role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, level, levelpath) as (
-- get records matches with parents
select t1.role_id, t1.role_name, t1.granted_role_id, t1.granted_role_name, 3 as level, t2.levelpath || '@' || t1.role_id as levelpath
from svv_role_grants t1
left join ancestors2 t2
on t1.role_id = t2.granted_role_id
where t1.role_id in (select granted_role_id from ancestors2)

union all

-- get records without parents (top node)
select granted_role_id as role_id, granted_role_name as role_name, null as granted_role_id, null granted_role_name, 3 as level, levelpath || '@' || granted_role_id
from ancestors2
where granted_role_id is not null
and granted_role_id not in (select role_id from svv_role_grants)
),

ancestors4 (role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, level, levelpath) as (
-- get records matches with parents
select t1.role_id, t1.role_name, t1.granted_role_id, t1.granted_role_name, 4 as level, t2.levelpath || '@' || t1.role_id as levelpath
from svv_role_grants t1
left join ancestors1 t2
on t1.role_id = t2.granted_role_id
where t1.role_id in (select granted_role_id from ancestors3)

union all

-- get records without parents (top node)
select granted_role_id as role_id, granted_role_name as role_name, null as granted_role_id, null granted_role_name, 4 as level, levelpath || '@' || granted_role_id
from ancestors3
where granted_role_id is not null
and granted_role_id not in (select role_id from svv_role_grants)
),

ancestors5 (role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, level, levelpath) as (
-- get records matches with parents
select t1.role_id, t1.role_name, t1.granted_role_id, t1.granted_role_name, 5 as level, t2.levelpath || '@' || t1.role_id as levelpath
from svv_role_grants t1
left join ancestors1 t2
on t1.role_id = t2.granted_role_id
where t1.role_id in (select granted_role_id from ancestors4)

union all

-- get records without parents (top node)
select granted_role_id as role_id, granted_role_name as role_name, null as granted_role_id, null granted_role_name, 5 as level, levelpath || '@' || granted_role_id
from ancestors4
where granted_role_id is not null
and granted_role_id not in (select role_id from svv_role_grants)
)

select * from ancestors1
union all
select * from ancestors2
union all
select * from ancestors3
union all
select * from ancestors4
union all
select * from ancestors5

union all

select null as role_id, ${users:singlequote} as role_name, null as granted_role_id, null as granted_role_name, 0 as level, '' as levelpath

)
order by levelpath
;

options.content:
## Groups assigned to User

This panel shows groups assigned to a user.

- To administrate users in group, use [ALTER GROUP](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/ja_jp/redshift/latest/dg/r_ALTER_GROUP.html).

targets.rawSQL:
SELECT
  t1.groname as group
FROM pg_group t1, pg_user t2
WHERE t2.usesysid = ANY(t1.grolist) 
AND t2.usename in (${users:singlequote})
ORDER BY 1
;

panels.title: Role and Group assigned to User

options.content:
## User Privileges

This panel shows privileges configured on users. 

- To administrat user privileges, use [ALTER USER](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/r_ALTER_USER.html).

panels.description: List of database user. num_group_assigned, num_roles_granted are the number of groups/roles assigned to each users. [pg_user](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/r_Users.html), [SVL_USER_INFO](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/r_SVL_USER_INFO.html)

targets.rawSQL:
select
  t1.usename, 
  decode(t1.usecreatedb, true, 'true', false, 'false') as usecreatedb,
  decode(t1.usesuper, true, 'true', false, 'false') as usesuper,
  decode(t1.usecatupd, true, 'true', false, 'false') as usecatupd,
  nvl(t2.num_groups_assigned, 0) as num_groups_assigned,
  nvl(t3.num_roles_granted, 0) as num_roles_granted
from pg_user t1

-- # of assigned groups
left join (
  select pg_user.usesysid, count(*) as num_groups_assigned
  from pg_user, pg_group
  where pg_user.usesysid = ANY(pg_group.grolist)
  group by pg_user.usesysid
  ) t2
on t1.usesysid = t2.usesysid

-- # of assigned roles
left join (
  select pg_user.usesysid, count(*) as num_roles_granted
  from pg_user
  where pg_user.usesysid in (select user_id from svv_user_grants)
  group by pg_user.usesysid
  ) t3
on t1.usesysid = t3.usesysid

where t1.usename in (${users:singlequote})
;

select
  usename, 
  decode(usecreatedb, true, 'true', false, 'false') as usecreatedb,
  decode(usesuper, true, 'true', false, 'false') as usesuper,
  decode(usecatupd, true, 'true', false, 'false') as usecatupd,
  useconnlimit,
  syslogaccess,
  sessiontimeout,
  external_id
from SVL_USER_INFO
where usename not like 'f346c9b8%'  -- ignore internal user
and usename in (${users:singlequote})
;

panels.title: User

options.content:
## Object Privileges

This section shows privileges granted on database objects. Database objects with no privileges configured does not appear in the panels below. 

- To to administrate, use
[GRANT](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/r_GRANT.html), 
[REVOKE](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/r_REVOKE.html).

targets.rawSQL:
select distinct
  t1.database_name,
  t1.identity_type, 
  t1.identity_name,
  case when t2.privilege_type is null then null else 'GRANTED' end as usage,
  case when t3.privilege_type is null then null else 'GRANTED' end as create,
  case when t4.privilege_type is null then null else 'GRANTED' end as temp
from SVV_DATABASE_PRIVILEGES t1

left join SVV_DATABASE_PRIVILEGES t2
on t1.database_name = t2.database_name
and t1.identity_type = t2.identity_type
and t1.identity_name = t2.identity_name
and t2.privilege_type = 'USAGE'

left join SVV_DATABASE_PRIVILEGES t3
on t1.database_name = t3.database_name
and t1.identity_type = t3.identity_type
and t1.identity_name = t3.identity_name
and t3.privilege_type = 'CREATE'

left join SVV_DATABASE_PRIVILEGES t4
on t1.database_name = t4.database_name
and t1.identity_type = t4.identity_type
and t1.identity_name = t4.identity_name
and t4.privilege_type = 'TEMP'

where t1.identity_type = 'user' and t1.identity_name in (${users:singlequote})
or t1.identity_type = 'group' and t1.identity_name in (${groups:singlequote})
or t1.identity_type = 'role' and t1.identity_name in (${roles:singlequote})
or t1.identity_type = 'public' and t1.identity_name in ('public')

order by 1, 2, 3
;

select distinct
	current_database() as database,
	t1.namespace_name as schema,
	t1.identity_type,
	t1.identity_name,
	case when t2.privilege_type is null then null else 'GRANTED' end as usage,
	case when t3.privilege_type is null then null else 'GRANTED' end as create
from SVV_SCHEMA_PRIVILEGES t1

left join SVV_SCHEMA_PRIVILEGES t2
on t1.namespace_name = t2.namespace_name
and t1.identity_type = t2.identity_type
and t1.identity_name = t2.identity_name
and t2.privilege_type = 'USAGE'

left join SVV_SCHEMA_PRIVILEGES t3
on t1.namespace_name = t3.namespace_name
and t1.identity_type = t3.identity_type
and t1.identity_name = t3.identity_name
and t3.privilege_type = 'CREATE'

where t1.namespace_name not in ('information_schema', 'pg_catalog', 'catalog_history', 'pg_automv', 'pg_toast', 'pg_internal', 'pg_temp_1')
and (
	t1.identity_type = 'user' and t1.identity_name in (${users:singlequote})
or t1.identity_type = 'group' and t1.identity_name in (${groups:singlequote})
or t1.identity_type = 'role' and t1.identity_name in (${roles:singlequote})
or t1.identity_type = 'public' and t1.identity_name in ('public')
)
order by 1, 2, 3, 4
;

select distinct
	current_database() as database,
	t1.namespace_name as schema,
    t2.table_type as relation_type,
    t1.relation_name as relation_name,
    t1.identity_type,
    t1.identity_name,
    case when t3.privilege_type is null then null else 'GRANTED' end as insert,
    case when t4.privilege_type is null then null else 'GRANTED' end as select,
    case when t5.privilege_type is null then null else 'GRANTED' end as update,
    case when t6.privilege_type is null then null else 'GRANTED' end as delete,
    case when t7.privilege_type is null then null else 'GRANTED' end as references,
    case when t8.privilege_type is null then null else 'GRANTED' end as drop
from SVV_RELATION_PRIVILEGES t1

-- add table_type
left join SVV_ALL_TABLES t2
on t1.namespace_name = t2.schema_name
and t1.relation_name = t2.table_name
and t2.database_name = current_database()

left join SVV_RELATION_PRIVILEGES t3
on t1.namespace_name = t3.namespace_name
and t1.relation_name = t3.relation_name
and t1.identity_type = t3.identity_type
and t1.identity_name = t3.identity_name
and t3.privilege_type = 'INSERT'

left join SVV_RELATION_PRIVILEGES t4
on t1.namespace_name = t4.namespace_name
and t1.relation_name = t4.relation_name
and t1.identity_type = t4.identity_type
and t1.identity_name = t4.identity_name
and t4.privilege_type = 'SELECT'

left join SVV_RELATION_PRIVILEGES t5
on t1.namespace_name = t5.namespace_name
and t1.relation_name = t5.relation_name
and t1.identity_type = t5.identity_type
and t1.identity_name = t5.identity_name
and t5.privilege_type = 'UPDATE'

left join SVV_RELATION_PRIVILEGES t6
on t1.namespace_name = t6.namespace_name
and t1.relation_name = t6.relation_name
and t1.identity_type = t6.identity_type
and t1.identity_name = t6.identity_name
and t6.privilege_type = 'DELETE'

left join SVV_RELATION_PRIVILEGES t7
on t1.namespace_name = t7.namespace_name
and t1.relation_name = t7.relation_name
and t1.identity_type = t7.identity_type
and t1.identity_name = t7.identity_name
and t7.privilege_type = 'REFERENCES'

left join SVV_RELATION_PRIVILEGES t8
on t1.namespace_name = t8.namespace_name
and t1.relation_name = t8.relation_name
and t1.identity_type = t8.identity_type
and t1.identity_name = t8.identity_name
and t8.privilege_type = 'DROP'

where t1.namespace_name not in ('information_schema', 'pg_catalog')
and (
	t1.identity_type = 'user' and t1.identity_name in (${users:singlequote})
or t1.identity_type = 'group' and t1.identity_name in (${groups:singlequote})
or t1.identity_type = 'role' and t1.identity_name in (${roles:singlequote})
or t1.identity_type = 'public' and t1.identity_name in ('public')
)
order by 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
;

select distinct
  current_database() as database,
  t1.namespace_name as schema,
  t1.relation_name as table,
  t1.column_name as column,
  t1.identity_type,
  t1.identity_name,
  case when t2.privilege_type is null then null else 'GRANTED' end as select,
  case when t3.privilege_type is null then null else 'GRANTED' end as update
from SVV_COLUMN_PRIVILEGES t1

left join SVV_COLUMN_PRIVILEGES t2
on t1.namespace_name = t2.namespace_name
and t1.relation_name = t2.relation_name
and t1.column_name = t2.column_name
and t1.identity_type = t2.identity_type
and t1.identity_name = t2.identity_name
and t2.privilege_type = 'SELECT'

left join SVV_COLUMN_PRIVILEGES t3
on t1.namespace_name = t3.namespace_name
and t1.relation_name = t3.relation_name
and t1.column_name = t3.column_name
and t1.identity_type = t3.identity_type
and t1.identity_name = t3.identity_name
and t3.privilege_type = 'UPDATE'

where (
	t1.identity_type = 'user' and t1.identity_name in (${users:singlequote})
or t1.identity_type = 'group' and t1.identity_name in (${groups:singlequote})
or t1.identity_type = 'role' and t1.identity_name in (${roles:singlequote})
or t1.identity_type = 'public' and t1.identity_name in ('public')
)
order by 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
;

select distinct
  t1.namespace_name as schema_name,
  t1.function_name,
  t1.argument_types,
  t2.function_type,
  t1.identity_type,
  t1.identity_name,
  case when t3.privilege_type is null then null else 'GRANTED' end as execute
from SVV_FUNCTION_PRIVILEGES t1

-- add function_type
left join SVV_REDSHIFT_FUNCTIONS t2
on t1.namespace_name = t2.schema_name
and t1.function_name = t2.function_name
and t2.database_name = current_database()

left join SVV_FUNCTION_PRIVILEGES t3
on t1.namespace_name = t3.namespace_name
and t1.function_name = t3.function_name
and t1.argument_types = t3.argument_types
and t1.identity_type = t3.identity_type
and t1.identity_name = t3.identity_name
and t3.privilege_type = 'EXECUTE'

where t2.schema_name not in ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
and t2.database_name = current_database()
and (
	t1.identity_type = 'user' and t1.identity_name in (${users:singlequote})
or t1.identity_type = 'group' and t1.identity_name in (${groups:singlequote})
or t1.identity_type = 'role' and t1.identity_name in (${roles:singlequote})
or t1.identity_type = 'public' and t1.identity_name in ('public')
)

order by 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
;

select distinct
  t1.language_name,
  t1.identity_type,
  t1.identity_name,
  case when t2.privilege_type is null then null else 'GRANTED' end as usage
from SVV_LANGUAGE_PRIVILEGES t1

left join SVV_LANGUAGE_PRIVILEGES t2
on t1.language_name = t2.language_name
and t1.identity_type = t2.identity_type
and t1.identity_name = t2.identity_name
and t2.privilege_type = 'USAGE'

where (
	t1.identity_type = 'user' and t1.identity_name in (${users:singlequote})
or t1.identity_type = 'group' and t1.identity_name in (${groups:singlequote})
or t1.identity_type = 'role' and t1.identity_name in (${roles:singlequote})
or t1.identity_type = 'public' and t1.identity_name in ('public')
)
order by 1, 2, 3
;

select distinct
  t1.namespace_name,
  t1.model_name,
  t1.model_version,
  t1.identity_type,
  t1.identity_name,
  case when t2.privilege_type is null then null else 'GRANTED' end as execute
from SVV_ML_MODEL_PRIVILEGES t1

left join SVV_ML_MODEL_PRIVILEGES t2
on t1.namespace_name = t2.namespace_name
and t1.model_name = t2.model_name
and t1.model_version = t2.model_version
and t1.identity_type = t2.identity_type
and t1.identity_name = t2.identity_name
and t2.privilege_type = 'EXECUTE'

where (
	t1.identity_type = 'user' and t1.identity_name in (${users:singlequote})
or t1.identity_type = 'group' and t1.identity_name in (${groups:singlequote})
or t1.identity_type = 'role' and t1.identity_name in (${roles:singlequote})
or t1.identity_type = 'public' and t1.identity_name in ('public')
)
order by 1, 2, 3, 4, 5
;

select distinct
  t1.datashare_name,
  t1.identity_type,
  t1.identity_name,
  case when t2.privilege_type is null then null else 'GRANTED' end as alter,
  case when t3.privilege_type is null then null else 'GRANTED' end as share
from SVV_DATASHARE_PRIVILEGES t1

left join SVV_DATASHARE_PRIVILEGES t2
on t1.datashare_name = t2.datashare_name
and t1.identity_type = t2.identity_type
and t1.identity_name = t2.identity_name
and t2.privilege_type = 'ALTER'


left join SVV_DATASHARE_PRIVILEGES t3
on t1.datashare_name = t3.datashare_name
and t1.identity_type = t3.identity_type
and t1.identity_name = t3.identity_name
and t3.privilege_type = 'SHARE'

where (
	t1.identity_type = 'user' and t1.identity_name in (${users:singlequote})
or t1.identity_type = 'group' and t1.identity_name in (${groups:singlequote})
or t1.identity_type = 'role' and t1.identity_name in (${roles:singlequote})
or t1.identity_type = 'public' and t1.identity_name in ('public')
)
order by 1, 2, 3
;

SELECT
  identity_type,
  identity_name,
  system_privilege
FROM svv_system_privileges
where (
	identity_type = 'user' and identity_name in (${users:singlequote})
or identity_type = 'group' and identity_name in (${groups:singlequote})
or identity_type = 'role' and identity_name in (${roles:singlequote})
or identity_type = 'public' and identity_name in ('public')
)
ORDER BY 1, 2, 3
;

options.content:
### Object Privileges (RLS)

This section shows [Row-level security (RLS)](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/t_rls.html) privileges granted on database objects. 

To administrate RLS, use:
- [ALTER TABLE](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/r_ALTER_TABLE.html)
- [CREATE RLS POLICY](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/r_CREATE_RLS_POLICY.html)
- [ATTACH RLS POLICY](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/r_ATTACH_RLS_POLICY.html)
- [DETACH RLS POLICY](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/r_DETACH_RLS_POLICY.html)
- [DROP RLS POLICY](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/r_DROP_RLS_POLICY.html)
- [GRANT](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/r_GRANT.html)
- [REVOKE](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/r_REVOKE.html)

panels.description: Policies attached to relations and user/roles. Policies not attached are not shown in this panel. [SVV_RLS_RELATION](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/r_SVV_RLS_RELATION.html), [SVV_RLS_POLICY](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/r_SVV_RLS_POLICY.html), [SVV_RLS_ATTACHED_POLICY](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/r_SVV_RLS_ATTACHED_POLICY.html)

targets.rawSQL:
-- nodes
select distinct
  *
from (

select 
  granteekind || grantee as id,
  grantee || ' (' || granteekind || ')' as title
from svv_rls_attached_policy

union all

select 
  polname as id,
  polname || ' (policy)' as title
from svv_rls_attached_policy

union all

select 
  relschema || relkind || relname as id,
  relschema || '.' || relname || ' (table)' as title
from svv_rls_attached_policy
where relkind = 'table'

union all

select 
  relschema || relkind || relname as id,
  relschema || '.' || relname || ' (view)' as title
from svv_rls_attached_policy
where relkind = 'view'

union all

-- add role/user hierarchy
select
  'role' || role_name as id, 
  role_name || ' (role)' as title
from svv_role_grants

union all 

select
  'role' || granted_role_name as id, 
  granted_role_name || ' (role)' as title
from svv_role_grants t1

union all

select
  'user' || user_name as id, 
  user_name || ' (user)'as title
from svv_user_grants
)
;

-- edges
select 
  *
from (

select
  relschema || relkind || relname as source,
  polname as target,
  relschema || relkind || relname || polname as id
from svv_rls_attached_policy

union all

select
  polname as source,
  granteekind || grantee as target,
  granteekind || grantee || polname as id
from svv_rls_attached_policy

union all

-- add role/user hierarchy
select
  'role' || granted_role_name as source,
  'role' || role_name as target, 
  role_name || granted_role_name as id
from svv_role_grants

union all

select 
  'role' || role_name as source, 
  'user' || user_name as target, 
  user_name || role_name as id
from svv_user_grants
)

where source in (
select distinct id
from (

select 
  granteekind || grantee as id,
  grantee || ' (' || granteekind || ')' as title
from svv_rls_attached_policy

union all

select 
  polname as id,
  polname || ' (policy)' as title
from svv_rls_attached_policy

union all

select 
  relschema || relkind || relname as id,
  relschema || '.' || relname || ' (table)' as title
from svv_rls_attached_policy
where relkind = 'table'

union all

select 
  relschema || relkind || relname as id,
  relschema || '.' || relname || ' (view)' as title
from svv_rls_attached_policy
where relkind = 'view'

union all

-- add role/user hierarchy
select
  'role' || role_name as id, 
  role_name || ' (role)' as title
from svv_role_grants

union all 

select
  'role' || granted_role_name as id, 
  granted_role_name || ' (role)' as title
from svv_role_grants t1

union all

select
  'user' || user_name as id, 
  user_name || ' (user)'as title
from svv_user_grants
))

and target in (
select distinct id
from (

select 
  granteekind || grantee as id,
  grantee || ' (' || granteekind || ')' as title
from svv_rls_attached_policy

union all

select 
  polname as id,
  polname || ' (policy)' as title
from svv_rls_attached_policy

union all

select 
  relschema || relkind || relname as id,
  relschema || '.' || relname || ' (table)' as title
from svv_rls_attached_policy
where relkind = 'table'

union all

select 
  relschema || relkind || relname as id,
  relschema || '.' || relname || ' (view)' as title
from svv_rls_attached_policy
where relkind = 'view'

union all

-- add role/user hierarchy
select
  'role' || role_name as id, 
  role_name || ' (role)' as title
from svv_role_grants

union all 

select
  'role' || granted_role_name as id, 
  granted_role_name || ' (role)' as title
from svv_role_grants t1

union all

select
  'user' || user_name as id, 
  user_name || ' (user)'as title
from svv_user_grants
)
)
;

panels.title: Policy Attachments

panels.description: List of RLS policies. CREATE/DROP RLS POLICY to manage. [SVV_RLS_POLICY](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/r_SVV_RLS_POLICY.html)

targets.rawSQL:
select 
  poldb,
  polname,
  polalias,
  polatts,
  polqual,
  decode(polenabled, true, 'true', false, 'false') as polenabled,
  polmodifiedby,
  polmodifiedtime
from svv_rls_policy
;

panels.title: Policies

panels.description: List of RLS policy attachment. ATTACH/DETACH RLS POLICY to manage. [SVV_RLS_ATTACHED_POLICY](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/r_SVV_RLS_ATTACHED_POLICY.html)

targets.rawSQL:
select 
  granteekind,
  grantee,
  polname,
  relschema,
  relname,
  relkind,
  grantor,
  decode(is_pol_on, true, 'true', false, 'false') as is_pol_on,
  decode(is_rls_on, true, 'true', false, 'false') as is_rls_on
from svv_rls_attached_policy
;

panels.title: Policy Attachments

panels.description: List of RLS-protected relation. Use ALTER TABLE to manage. [SVV_RLS_POLICY](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/r_SVV_RLS_POLICY.html)
panels.title: RLS protected relation

targets.rawSQL:
select 
  recordtime::varchar,
  pid,
  xid,
  query::varchar as query_id,
  username, 
  datname,
  relschema,
  relname,
  polname,
  poldefault
from svv_rls_applied_policy
order by recordtime
;

query.rawSQL:
select usename
from pg_user
order by 1
;

with groups as (
SELECT t1.groname
FROM pg_group t1, pg_user t2
WHERE t2.usesysid = ANY(t1.grolist) 
AND t2.usename in (${users:singlequote})
)

select * from groups

union all

select 'N/A' where not exists (select * from groups) -- return at least 1 row for grafana template variable

ORDER BY 1
;

list.description: Roles user is directly assigned or inherited
list.label: Role
list.name: roles

query.rawSQL:
-- This queries 5 layers of Role for given user. 
-- Searching parent roles for more than 6 layer is disabled for performance reason. You can uncomment queries if you need to retrive parents over level 6 but keep in mind that this may impact query performance. 
-- Note: The query can be rewritten by recursive CTE but recursive CTE does not work with system table due to restriction of leader node function. 

WITH roles as (

WITH
target_roles (role_id, role_name) as (
select role_id, role_name 
from svv_user_grants 
where user_name in (${users:singlequote})
),

ancestors1 (role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, level) as (
-- get records with parents
select role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, 1 as level
from svv_role_grants
where role_id in (select role_id from target_roles)

union all

-- get records without parents (top node)
select role_id as role_id, role_name as role_name, null as granted_role_id, null as granted_role_name, 1 as level
from target_roles
where role_id not in (select role_id from svv_role_grants)
),

ancestors2 (role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, level) as (
-- get records matches with parents
select role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, 2 as level
from svv_role_grants
where role_id in (select granted_role_id from ancestors1)

union all

-- get records without parents (top node)
select granted_role_id as role_id, granted_role_name as role_name, null as granted_role_id, null granted_role_name, 2 as level
from ancestors1
where granted_role_id is not null
and granted_role_id not in (select role_id from svv_role_grants)
),

ancestors3 (role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, level) as (
-- get records matches with parents
select role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, 3 as level
from svv_role_grants
where role_id in (select granted_role_id from ancestors2)

union all

-- get records without parents (top node)
select granted_role_id as role_id, granted_role_name as role_name, null as granted_role_id, null granted_role_name, 3 as level
from ancestors2
where granted_role_id is not null
and granted_role_id not in (select role_id from svv_role_grants)
),

ancestors4 (role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, level) as (
-- get records matches with parents
select role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, 4 as level
from svv_role_grants
where role_id in (select granted_role_id from ancestors3)

union all

-- get records without parents (top node)
select granted_role_id as role_id, granted_role_name as role_name, null as granted_role_id, null granted_role_name, 4 as level
from ancestors3
where granted_role_id is not null
and granted_role_id not in (select role_id from svv_role_grants)
),

ancestors5 (role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, level) as (
-- get records matches with parents
select role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, 5 as level
from svv_role_grants
where role_id in (select granted_role_id from ancestors4)

union all

-- get records without parents (top node)
select granted_role_id as role_id, granted_role_name as role_name, null as granted_role_id, null granted_role_name, 5 as level
from ancestors4
where granted_role_id is not null
and granted_role_id not in (select role_id from svv_role_grants)
),

ancestors6 (role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, level) as (
-- get records matches with parents
select role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, 6 as level
from svv_role_grants
where role_id in (select granted_role_id from ancestors5)

union all

-- get records without parents (top node)
select granted_role_id as role_id, granted_role_name as role_name, null as granted_role_id, null granted_role_name, 6 as level
from ancestors5
where granted_role_id is not null
and granted_role_id not in (select role_id from svv_role_grants)
),

ancestors7 (role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, level) as (
-- get records matches with parents
select role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, 7 as level
from svv_role_grants
where role_id in (select granted_role_id from ancestors6)

union all

-- get records without parents (top node)
select granted_role_id as role_id, granted_role_name as role_name, null as granted_role_id, null granted_role_name, 7 as level
from ancestors6
where granted_role_id is not null
and granted_role_id not in (select role_id from svv_role_grants)
),

ancestors8 (role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, level) as (
-- get records matches with parents
select role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, 8 as level
from svv_role_grants
where role_id in (select granted_role_id from ancestors7)

union all

-- get records without parents (top node)
select granted_role_id as role_id, granted_role_name as role_name, null as granted_role_id, null granted_role_name, 8 as level
from ancestors7
where granted_role_id is not null
and granted_role_id not in (select role_id from svv_role_grants)
),

ancestors9 (role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, level) as (
-- get records matches with parents
select role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, 9 as level
from svv_role_grants
where role_id in (select granted_role_id from ancestors8)

union all

-- get records without parents (top node)
select granted_role_id as role_id, granted_role_name as role_name, null as granted_role_id, null granted_role_name, 9 as level
from ancestors8
where granted_role_id is not null
and granted_role_id not in (select role_id from svv_role_grants)
),

ancestors10 (role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, level) as (
-- get records matches with parents
select role_id, role_name, granted_role_id, granted_role_name, 10 as level
from svv_role_grants
where role_id in (select granted_role_id from ancestors9)

union all

-- get records without parents (top node)
select granted_role_id as role_id, granted_role_name as role_name, null as granted_role_id, null granted_role_name, 10 as level
from ancestors9
where granted_role_id is not null
and granted_role_id not in (select role_id from svv_role_grants)
)

select * from ancestors1
union all
select * from ancestors2
union all
select * from ancestors3
union all
select * from ancestors4
union all
select * from ancestors5
--union all
--select * from ancestors6
--union all
--select * from ancestors7
--union all
--select * from ancestors8
--union all
--select * from ancestors9
--union all
--select * from ancestors10

)

select role_name from roles
union all 
select 'N/A' as role_name where not exists (select role_name from roles)  -- return at least 1 row for grafana template variable

order by role_name
;
